messages.content:
warning Lockfile has incorrect entry for "@babel/core@^7.14.0". Ignoring it.
[2/4] ðŸšš  Fetching packages...
error @apollo/federation@0.27.0: The engine "node" is incompatible with this module. Expected version ">=12.13.0 <17.0". Got "18.8.0"
error Found incompatible module.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/install for documentation about this command.
npm ERR! code 1
npm ERR! path /Users/bilalghalib/Downloads/lexicon-staging
npm ERR! command failed
npm ERR! command sh -c yarn --cwd api install && yarn --cwd frontend install

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /Users/bilalghalib/.npm/_logs/2023-04-29T15_48_06_379Z-debug-0.log

It seems that there are two errors in the log you provided:

1. The first error is a warning about an incorrect entry in the lockfile for "@babel/core@^7.14.0", which is being ignored. This warning message is not fatal and can be safely ignored.

2. The second error is a bit more serious, and it states that the version of Node.js being used (18.8.0) is not compatible with the version of the "@apollo/federation" module being installed (0.27.0). The "@apollo/federation" module requires a version of Node.js that is ">=12.13.0 <17.0", which means that you will need to use a version of Node.js that falls within this range in order to install this module.

To fix this error, you can either downgrade your version of Node.js to a version that is compatible with "@apollo/federation", or you can look for a more recent version of the module that is compatible with the version of Node.js you are currently using.
